title: Avaya IP Office one-X Portal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Avaya IP Office one-X Portal. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the UserConfigurationService and UploadFromLocalDriveServlet servlets.  The UserConfigurationService servlet does not properly validate user-supplied data allowing for the super user account to be reset.  The UploadFromLocalDriveServlet servlet also fails to validate user-supplied data allowing for arbitrary file writes with SYSTEM level privileges.  An attacker can leverage these vulnerabilities to execute code with SYSTEM level privileges.
addtionnal_details: Avaya has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://downloads.avaya.com/css/P8/documents/100178987
timeline:
2013-04-14 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2014-04-03 - Coordinated public release of advisory
